result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnold E Branch Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Retail Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

The Court ordered all costs (except dna surcharge) waived due to indigency.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

No use of alcohol, controlled substances/illegal drugs, or possession of drug paraphernalia.
Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in Anger Management program.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold E Branch Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed telephone call.

Defendant Arnold E Branch in court with student intern Larissa Dallman under the supervision of attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to negotiations and on oral motion of the State. The Court ordered the following:
Count 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.
Count 2, Retail Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.50, a Class A Misdemeanor.

As to Count 1 as amended and Count 2:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Arnold E Branch in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, parties request more time.  Court granted request for an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for  bail review.  After off the record discussion, Court does not need to address violation at this time.  Case remains calendared for plea hearing 05/08/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 04/27/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Arnold E Branch in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Original Transcript PLELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing MARCH 5, 2015 received and filed.kl

Defendant Arnold E Branch in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Ben Wesson for Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jasen  Rydzewski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/4/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sarfaraz S. or Citgo Gas at 2627 W Capitol Drive

Defendant Arnold E Branch in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Arnold E Branch in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  State moves to amend offense date in the charging portion of criminal complaint to reflect the correct date of Friday, November 14, 2014.  Court grants request.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
